definition: public trial (in a court of law)

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: Criminal. Why had he agreed to this ludicrous show trial?
sentences.chinese: 爲何他同意這一滑稽的擺擺樣子的家族公審呢？

sentences.english: The despot and traitor was brought to public trial during the land reform and all his crimes were exposed.
sentences.chinese: 土改時公審了那個惡霸兼漢奸，並揭露了其全部罪行。

definition: to defend oneself/to rebut a charge
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
variant of 誣衊|诬蔑[wu1 mie4]
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
to keep quiet out of fear (idiom)
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
